name: Mini Molecular Repair Hair Mask & Oil Value Set
about: What it is:This set helps to care for hair damage, reduce frizz, restore hair health, soften, smooth, and add shine..Hair Texture:Straight, Wavy, Curly, and Coily.Hair Type:Fine, Medium, and Thick.Hair Concerns:- Damage, Split Ends, and Breakage.Key Benefits:- Cares for hair damage from bleach, color, chemical services, and heat in as few as four minutes.Highlighted Ingredients:- K18PEPTIDE: Targets damage from bleach, color, chemical services, and heat..Ingredient Callouts:These products are vegan..What Else You Need to Know:These products help you care for hair damage and fight frizz. The leave-in mask helps targets hair damage from bleach, color, chemical services, and heat in as little as four minutes‚Äîrestoring strength, softness, smoothness, and bounce. The hair oil, a strengthening, defrizz solution, delivers immediate and long-term frizz control, improving shine and reducing split ends while offering up to 450¬∞F (232 ¬∞C) heat protection..Fragrance Description:These products have a fresh-floral scent with notes of jasmine and peony..Clinical Results:In a clinical study, 1 4-minute application of the Leave-In Molecular Repair Hair Mask showed improved strength and elasticity in hair damaged by bleach, color, chemical services, and heat..This Set Contains:- 0.5 oz/ 15 mL Leave-In Molecular Repair Hair Mask.Clean at Sephora
ingredients: -K18PEPTIDE: Targets damage from bleach, color, chemical services, and heat..-Hemisqualane and Squalene: Reinforces hair's moisture barrier, smooths flyaways, and enhances shine..-Avocado Oil: Provides heat protection up to 450¬∞F (232¬∞C)...Leave-In Molecular Repair Hair Mask:.Water (Aqua) (Eau), Alcohol Denat., Propylene Glycol, Cetearyl Alcohol, Dicaprylyl Ether, Cetyl Esters, Behentrimonium Chloride, Polysorbate 20, sh-Oligopeptide-78 (K18PEPTIDE‚Ñ¢), Hydrolyzed Wheat Protein, Hydrolyzed Wheat Starch, Isopropyl Alcohol, Tocopherol, Phenoxyethanol, Potassium Sorbate, Citric Acid, Fragrance (Parfum), Geraniol, Linalool, Hexyl Cinnamal, Benzyl Alcohol...Molecular Repair Hair Oil:.Caprylyl Caprylate/Caprate, Squalene, Persea Gratissima (Avocado) Oil, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Oil, C13-15 Alkane, Undecane, Benzyl Alcohol, Tridecane, Castor Isostearate Succinate, Propanediol, SH-Oligopeptide-78 (K18PEPTIDE), Fragrance (Parfum), Tocopherol, Cinnamal, Hexyl Cinnamal, Limonene, Linalool...The list of ingredients is subject to change. Please consult the packaging of the product purchased.
how_to_use: Leave-In Molecular Repair Hair Mask: .- After shampooing, do NOT condition. .- Towel-dry hair. .- Apply 3-9 pumps of molecular repair hair mask to mid-lengths and ends. Begin with 3 pumps and build as needed. .- Let sit for 4 minutes. .- Do not rinse out. .- Style as usual. ..Molecular Repair Hair Oil:.- Apply with 1-3 drops on damp hair for additonal damage repair, then wait 4 minutes before styling..- Apply with 1-3 drops on dry hair as a finisher for additional shine...PRO Tip:.- Highly concentrated formulas. Start with the minimum recommended amount and build as needed.

reviews.review_text: All I'll say is that both products have the goal to provide excellent repairing results. I colored my hair a week ago and after that I've been using both products and can tell you that the results are fantastic. What drew me in was the formula, which is free of sulfates, parabens, and silicones, which is beneficial for people trying to keep healthy hair. In my perspective, the shampoo cleans your hair nicely without leaving it oily, yet you can tell it's moisturized. On the other hand, the reset repair mask contains biomimetic peptides that help restore the hair's natural structure, providing you with softer and smoother hair. While the price point is on the higher side, in my opinion the results justify the investment, especially for those with heavily processed or damaged hair like me. Be mindful that this is my own experience; every hair is different. If you‚Äôre looking for a set that effectively repairs and revitalizes damaged hair, the K18 Ultimate Reset + Repair Mask and Shampoo set is worth considering.

reviews.review_text: The K18 Mini Molecular Repair set, which includes the mask and oil, promises to transform damaged hair with its advanced technology. I found it a bit odd not to use conditioner at first, but I decided to trust the process. After using the mask, I noticed a significant difference. My hair felt much softer and looked visibly healthier. The elasticity improved, it felt strong and manageable while styling. I loved that it doesn‚Äôt require rinsing, allowing the product to stay in my hair. Post-application, my hair previously damaged by bleaching showed less breakage and a noticeable reduction in frizz. While I didn‚Äôt conduct a scientific elasticity test, the overall feel was very positive. Molecular Repair Hair Oil: This oil is applied to damp hair, using just a few drops. I was surprised by how lightweight it is, it absorbs quickly without leaving a greasy feel. After applying the oil, my hair shone like never before. It felt smooth and manageable, which is essential for me, especially on humid days. The frizz control throughout the day was impressive. The oil claims to reduce split ends by 78%. While I didn‚Äôt count them, I definitely noticed my ends looking healthier and less damaged. Plus, the heat protection up to 450¬∞F is a huge relief since I frequently use heat styling tools. K18 Mini Molecular Repair set exceeded my expectations. Together, the mask and oil transformed my damaged hair into something manageable and radiant. The results were evident after the first use, making it a great option for anyone struggling with hair damage from coloring or heat styling.

reviews.review_text: I have tried K18 Leave-In Molecular Repair Hair Mask in the past and already knew I enjoyed this product. I was highlighted a few months ago and spent many hours in the sun, causing my ends to feel dry and not have the shine I am used to.  This mask really helped to give my hair a boost and bring it back to life. My hair feels hydrated and some shine has been restored. I still notice a bit of damage towards the ends that will need to be cut, but overall, I'm very pleased with how much this mask helps the look and feel of my hair. This was my first time trying the Molecular Repair Hair Oil and I was a little skeptical about the small amount recommended to be used. I applied when wet and also added when dry, and I feel this works best as a finishing oil for my hair. I instantly noticed a glossy, defined finish and it also helped make my faded and slightly brassy highlights pop against my dark hair. I did use a few extra drops since my hair is coarse and thick, but much less than I would with other hair oils, which is impressive and makes the mini sizes last longer than expected. I would definitely repurchase and recommend both products in the set. I think this set would make a great present or introduction for any one to the K18 line.
